column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Answer|Answer
#Text=Question 6: Can this app share my contacts list?
#Text=--------[START OF POLICY]---------
#Text=
#Text=
#Text=﻿Privacy Policy\r
#Text=Learn more about Privacy in GeoZilla\r
#Text=GeoZilla, Inc. and its affiliates and subsidiaries (collectively, “GeoZilla” or “we” or “us”) is committed to protecting privacy of your personal data.

#Text=This Privacy Policy applies to those who visit the websites owned and operated by GeoZilla, download any downloadable software, install any mobile applications, and/or use the Company’s products and services offered at www.geozilla.com (collectively, the “GeoZilla Service”).This Privacy Policy describes how GeoZilla collects, uses, shares and secures the personal data of the users of GeoZilla Service (the “User(s)” or “you” or “yours”, as applicable).
#Text=It also describes your choices regarding use, access and correction of your personal data.

#Text=The capitalized terms used in this Privacy Policy but not defined herein shall have the same meaning assigned to them in GeoZilla’s Terms of Use (https://geozilla.com/terms-of-use.html) (the “Terms”).If you have questions or complaints regarding our Privacy Policy or practices, please contact us at support@geozilla.com.
#Text=Our Privacy Policy may be modified from time-to-time.
#Text=We will alert you that changes have been made by indicating on our Privacy Policy the date it was last updated.
#Text=If we make any material changes, we will notify you by email or by means of a notice on this website prior to the change becoming effective.
#Text=We encourage you to periodically review this page for the latest information on our privacy practices.\r
#Text=1.
#Text=What is Personal Information?

#Text=Personal Information is personally identifiable information such as your name, telephone number, email address and any other non-public information about you that is associated with or linked to any of the foregoing information.
#Text=Personal information does not include aggregate information, which is general user data we collect about the use of GeoZilla.
#Text=Our Privacy Policy does not restrict or limit our collection and use of aggregate information.\r
#Text=2.
#Text=What Personal Information Does GeoZilla Collect?
#Text=2.1 Information you provide for the use of technology\r
#Text=* Registration and Profile Information.

#Text=When you create an account, we may collect your personal information such as your username, first and last name, birth date, email address, mobile phone number and a photo, if you choose to have a photo associated with your account.
#Text=If you want to add a child or family member’s name to your account, we collect the child or family member’s name, email address, and mobile phone number.
#Text=We may collect billing information when you sign up for the Premium service.
#Text=We may collect additional information from a parent in order to obtain verifiable parental consent to allow a child to use the GeoZilla Service.

#Text=When you register in our app with social media, such as Facebook, we receive information from the social network such as your profile information, profile picture, gender, user name, user ID associated with your social media account, age range, language, country, and any other information you permit the social network to share with third parties.
#Text=The data we receive is dependent upon your privacy settings with the social network
#Text=.
#Text=* Location Services.
#Text=We collect your location through GPS, WiFi, or wireless network triangulation in order to obtain your location for the purposes of providing the GeoZilla Service.
#Text=GeoZilla is also using location services in the background to provide a key safety feature: so the parent users can get real-time geofence alerts from their children.

#Text=While you are logged in to your account and have location services enabled, we will continue to collect your location information in order to provide the GeoZilla Service (for example, to provide the GeoZilla Services or to share your location with the members you allow to see your location).
#Text=We maintain location information only so long as is reasonable to provide the Service and then delete the location data
#Text=.
#Text=* Messages and User Content.
#Text=We collect information when you message other members of your Family through the use of the service.
#Text=We may also retain any messages you send to us.

#Text=GeoZilla only collects "sensitive" personal information when you voluntarily provide us with this information or where such information is required or permitted to be collected by law or professional standards.

#Text=Sensitive information includes personal information regarding a person's race, ethnicity, political, philosophical religious or similar beliefs, trade union membership, physical or mental health, sexual life, sexual orientation, or criminal record.

#Text=Please use your discretion when providing sensitive information to the Company, and under any circumstances, do not provide sensitive information to us, unless you thereby consent to our use of that information for its legitimate business purposes and consent to the transfer and storage of such information to and in our databases.

#Text=If you have any questions about whether the provision of sensitive information to GeoZilla is, or may be, necessary or appropriate for particular purposes, please contact us at support@geozilla.com.\r
#Text=2.2 Automatically collected information through the use of technology:\r

#Text=When you use the GeoZilla Service, we and our business partners may collect certain information about your computer or device through technology such as cookies, web beacons, log files, or other tracking/recording tools.

#Text=The information we collect through the use of tracking technologies includes, but is not limited to, IP address, browser information, referring/exit pages and URLs, click stream data and how you interact with links on the website, mobile app, the GeoZilla Service, domain names, landing pages, page views, cookie data that allows us to uniquely identify your browser, browsing behavior on our site, mobile device type, mobile device IDs or other persistent identifiers, and location data collected from your mobile device.
#Text=Some or all of this data may be combined with other personally identifying information described above
#Text=.
#Text=* Remember information so that you will not have to re-enter it during your visit or the next time you use the GeoZilla\r
#Text=* Provide custom, personalized content and information\r
#Text=* Monitor the effectiveness of our Service and our marketing campaigns\r
#Text=* Monitor aggregate metrics such as total number of visitors, users, traffic, and demographic patterns\r
#Text=* Diagnose or fix technology problems reported by our Users or engineers that are associated with certain IP addresses or User IDs\r
#Text=* Automatically update our mobile application on your system and related devices\r
#Text=2.3 Driving Event Data:\r

#Text=We collect, and may use a third-party partner to collect, sensory and motion data from your smartphone or mobile device, including information from the gyroscope, accelerometer, compass and bluetooth, in order to calculate and detect driving events such as speeding, hard braking, crash detection and other events.
#Text=We may also share this information with third party partners for marketing and research purposes.
#Text=If you want to opt-out, please adjust your settings in your mobile device to limit the app’s access to your sensory and motion data.\r
#Text=2.4 Children’s Privacy:\r
#Text=GeoZilla allows parents to keep track of their children’s location on mobile devices that the parent has added to their account.
#Text=The service is intended to be used by children under 13 only with parental approval.
#Text=If a parent wishes to add a User who is under 13 to the Family account, the parent must send GeoZilla Parental Consent via email.
#Text=The child’s personal information will be shared with other members of the family account.
#Text=GeoZilla may then use the child’s personal information as described in this Privacy Policy.

#Text=However, we do not use or share personal information collected from the accounts of children under 13 for marketing or advertising purposes, or permit our third party partners to collect and use such information for advertising purposes.
#Text=Please contact us at support@geozilla.com if you have questions about your child’s account.
#Text=If you believe that we might have inadvertently collected information from a child under 13 without parental consent, please contact us.\r
#Text=3.
#Text=How Does GeoZilla Use Personal Information?
#Text=Generally, GeoZilla collects, stores, uses and discloses information to enable us to:\r
#Text=* provide the GeoZilla service;\r
#Text=* create your account;\r
#Text=* identify you as a user;\r
#Text=* respond to your inquiries and emails;\r
#Text=* improve the application;\r
#Text=* send you administrative and service related communications;\r
#Text=* send you newsletters, surveys, offers, and other promotional materials;\r
#Text=* monitor the effectiveness of our Service and our marketing campaigns.

#Text=If you are an individual from the European Economic Area (EEA), we use your Personal Information, we may process your personal data on one or more of the following legal grounds: (i) because processing is necessary to perform a contract with you, such as to deliver the GeoZilla Service; (ii) to comply with our legal obligations; (iii) because processing is necessary for purposes of our legitimate interest or those of any third party recipients that receive your personal data, provided that such interests are not overridden by your interests or fundamental rights and freedoms.
#Text=We may also process your Personal Information based on your consent where you have expressly given that to us\r
#Text=3.1 Third Party Analytics\r
#Text=We may also collect analytics data, or use third-party analytics tools, to help us measure traffic and usage trends for the GeoZilla Service.

#Text=Tools like Appsflyer, Flurry and Firebase collect information sent by your browser or mobile device, including the pages you visit, your use of third-party applications, and other information that assists us in analyzing and improving the Service.
#Text=Anonymous aggregate statistics that do not personally identify the Users will be kept and used by us for various purposes including analysis and reporting of usage patterns.

#Text=When you access the GeoZilla Service by or through a mobile device, we may receive or collect and store a unique identification numbers associated with your device or our mobile application (including, for example, a UDID, Unique ID for Advertisers (“IDFA”), Google Ad ID, or other identifier), mobile carrier, device type, model and manufacturer, mobile device operating system brand and model, phone number, and, depending on your mobile device settings, your geographical location data, including GPS coordinates (e.g. latitude and/or longitude), WiFi location or similar information regarding the location of your mobile device.\r
#Text=3.2 Third Party Ad Networks\r

#Text=We may share, or permit third party ad networks, social media companies, and other third party services to collect information about your use of the GeoZilla Service over time, so that they may play or display ads that may be relevant to your interests on the GeoZilla Service as well as on other websites, apps or services, or on other devices you may use.
#Text=We may also display targeted advertising to you through social media platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and others.

#Text=These third-party ad partners may collect information such as clickstream information, timestamp, hashed email address, device ID or AdID, and information about your use of third-party applications.
#Text=They may also collect and analyze information about your use of the GeoZilla Service in order to recognize you across various devices you use.\r
#Text=3.3 Integrated IoT Partners\r

#Text=For our IoT users: please be aware that GeoZilla may receive the following data from our partner devices: anonymized authorization token, anonymous account ID, SOS signal, tracker ID, anonymous location data.
#Text=These data do not contain any user details and are used solely to trigger SOS alerts to circle members inside GeoZilla mobile app.\r
#Text=4.
#Text=How Does GeoZilla Share Your Personal Information?
#Text=We share your personal information, including name, email, location and driving event data, with others within your GeoZilla circles.

#Text=We may share your personal information, including your location data, driving sensor data, unique identifiers or AD IDs and other data with third parties for their marketing and business purposes, including without limitation, to inform and improve third-party advertising.
#Text=These third-party partners may use this information according to their own privacy policies.

#Text=We share your personal information, driving event data and other information to Sentiance NV/SA (“Sentiance”), which provides driving analytics behavior services to enable us to provide Driver Protection service.

#Text=You hereby acknowledge and consent to the collection and use of your data and information by Sentiance as set out in this policy and in Sentiance’s Privacy Policy, which is located at https://www.sentiance.com/privacy/\r
#Text=Any information or content that you voluntarily post to our App Store and Google Play Store, or our social media pages will automatically be available to the public.
#Text=We may publicly post your reviews and comments online.
#Text=From time to time, we may employ third parties to help us provide or improve the GeoZilla Service.

#Text=These third parties, such as our analytics or hosting provider, may have limited access to databases of user information or registered member information solely for the purpose of helping us provide or improve the Service and they will not be able to use the information about our members or visitors for any other purpose.

#Text=We may disclose personal Information in some other limited circumstances, but we will specifically describe them to you when we collect the information, such as in the terms of use for a new service or by revising this Privacy Policy.

#Text=We may, and you hereby authorize us to, disclose your Personal Information (including messages) to a third party without your consent: if we have reason to believe that disclosing this information is necessary to identify, contact or bring legal action against someone who may be causing injury to or interference with (either intentionally or unintentionally) our rights or property, other website users, or anyone else (including the rights or property of anyone else) that could be harmed by such activities, in connection with any legal investigation, when we believe in good faith that such disclosure is required by and in accordance with the law or to respond to subpoenas or warrants served on GeoZilla, to any third party with your prior consent to do so.
#Text=Except as set out in this Privacy Policy, your personal Information will not be used for any other purpose without informing you first by updating this Privacy Policy.

#Text=Except for the limited disclosures described in this Privacy Policy, we do not sell customer lists or any personal information to third parties, and we will take all possible measures to keep your email address private to keep your email address private.\r
#Text=5.
#Text=How Does GeoZilla Protect Your Personal Information?
#Text=The security of your Personal Information is important to us.

#Text=We use all commercially reasonable efforts to store and maintain your Personal Information and location information in a secure environment and have implemented reasonable procedures designed to limit unauthorized access, use or disclosure of your Personal Information.
#Text=We encrypt the transmission of your location-based data using secure technologies to preserve the integrity and security of all information we collect.
#Text=Despite these measures, you should know that GeoZilla cannot fully eliminate security risks associated with Personal Information.

#Text=In the event that any information under our control is compromised as a result of a breach of security, we will take reasonable steps to investigate the situation and where appropriate, notify those individuals whose information may have been compromised and take other steps, in accordance with any applicable laws and regulations.
#Text=Please also remember, that to protect the communications that have taken place in the app, never give out your password.\r
#Text=6.
#Text=How Long We Retain Your Personal Information:\r

#Text=We will retain your Personal Information for as long as is needed to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law (such as tax, accounting or other legal requirements).

#Text=When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your personal information, we will either delete or anonymize it, or, if this is not possible (for example, because your personal information has been stored in backup archives), then we will securely store your personal information and isolate it from any further processing until deletion is possible.
#Text=For personal information that we process on behalf of our Users, we will retain such personal information in accordance with the terms of our agreement with them, subject to applicable law\r
#Text=7.
#Text=How Can I Update User Access or Deactivate my Account?
#Text=If your personal information changes, or if you no longer desire the GeoZilla Service, you may email us at support@geozilla.com to deactivate your account.
#Text=You may also correct, update, or amend your personal information in your profile settings within the GeoZilla app or by emailing us.
#Text=Removing GeoZilla from your mobile device will not delete the personal information that has been retained about you.
#Text=If you leave your circles, we will retain your user content in the event that you would like to access it in the future.
#Text=Your user content can be deleted permanently by emailing a request to support@geozilla.com.\r
#Text=8.
#Text=How Can I Manage Communication with GeoZilla?
#Text=You may "opt out" of receiving marketing or promotional emails from us by following the instructions in those emails or by emailing us at support@geozilla.com.
#Text=If you opt out, we may still send you non-promotional emails, such as emails about your accounts or our ongoing business relations.
#Text=To opt out of push notifications, please edit settings within the app or change your settings at the device level.\r
#Text=9.
#Text=What Laws are GeoZilla Governed by?
#Text=GeoZilla is a global company, based in the United States.

#Text=If you are a user accessing GeoZilla from any other region with laws or regulations governing personal data collection, use, and disclosure that differ from United States laws, please be advised that through your continued use of GeoZilla, which is governed by the United States law, GeoZilla Privacy Policy, and Terms of Service, you are transferring your personal information to the United States and you consent to that transfer.\r
#Text=10.
#Text=Additional Rights For EEA And Certain Other Territories:\r
#Text=If you are from certain territories (such as the EEA), you may have the right to exercise additional rights available to you under applicable laws, as follows:\r
#Text=What is a Subject Access Request?
#Text=This is your right to request a copy of the information that we hold about you.
#Text=If you would like a copy of some or all your personal information, please contact us at support@geozilla.com.
#Text=We will respond to your request within thirty days of receipt of the request.
#Text=We want to make sure your personal information is accurate and up to date.
#Text=You may ask us to correct or remove information you think is inaccurate by support@geozilla.com.
#Text=We will consider your request in accordance with applicable laws.
#Text=To protect your privacy and security, we may take steps to verify your identity before complying with the request\r
#Text=Objections to processing of personal data\r
#Text=It is your right to lodge an objection to the processing of your personal data if you feel the “ground relating to your particular situation” apply.

#Text=The only reasons we will be able to deny your request is if we can show compelling legitimate grounds for the processing, which override your interest, rights and freedoms, or the processing is for the establishment, exercise or defense of a legal claims.
#Text=To invoke this right, please contact us at support@geozilla.com.
#Text=We will consider your request in accordance with applicable laws.
#Text=To protect your privacy and security, we may take steps to verify your identity before complying with the request.
#Text=Data Portability\r

#Text=It is also your right to receive the personal data which you have given to us, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit that data to another controller without delay from the current controller if:\r
#Text=(a) The processing is based on consent or on a contract, and\r
#Text=(b) The processing is carried out by automated means.
#Text=To invoke this right, please contact us at support@geozilla.com.
#Text=We will consider your request in accordance with applicable laws.
#Text=To protect your privacy and security, we may take steps to verify your identity before complying with the request\r
#Text=Your Right to be Forgotten\r
#Text=Should you wish for us to completely delete all information that we hold about you for, contact us at support@geozilla.com.
#Text=Please note, however, that we may need to retain certain information for record keeping purposes, to complete transactions or to comply with our legal obligations.
#Text=You also have the right to complain to a data protection authority about our collection and use of your personal information.
#Text=For more information, please contact your local data protection authority.
#Text=If you feel that your personal data has been processed in a way that does not meet the GDPR, you have a specific right to lodge a complaint with the relevant supervisory authority.
#Text=The supervisory authority will then tell you of the progress and outcome of your complaint\r
#Text=11.
#Text=California Privacy Rights\r
#Text=We will not share any Personal Data with third-parties for their direct marketing purposes to the extent prohibited by California law.
#Text=If our practices change, we will do so in accordance with applicable laws and will notify you in advance\r
#Text=12.
#Text=Questions?
#Text=Please contact us at support@geozilla.com if you have any questions about our Privacy Policy.
#Text=--------[END OF POLICY]---------
#Text=
#Text=
#Text=Question 6: Can this app share my contacts list?
#Text=<ANSWER FROM POLICY>

column4: \[SILENT\] The policy is silent about this practice,[1]
\[SILENT\] The policy is silent about this practice,[1]
\[SILENT\] The policy is silent about this practice,[1]
